item.title: Adding coords to a spellbook teleport
item.dc:creator: @runewings317 runewings317
item.description:
@runewings317 wrote:

[quote=“h3rbl0re, post:11, topic:381583”]c.getPA().spellTeleport(3251,3919,2);
c.sendMessage(“Walk west to find the Chaos Elemental”);
} else if (c.teleAction == 4) {

that is what i have…[/quote]
I don’t see how this is helping us in anyway… What case are you using? Use this:

case CASEIDHERE: c.getPA().startTeleport(3251, 3919, 2, "modern"); c.sendMessage("Walk west to find the Chaos Elemental"); break;

Read full topic

item.source: Adding coords to a spellbook teleport

item.title: Adding coords to a spellbook teleport
item.dc:creator: @adamknightz adamknightz
item.description:
@adamknightz wrote:

To change the cords of a teleport spell search “Config.java”. Then, ctrl+F search “varrock”.

Now you’ll see a bunch of teleport names and cords. For example:

	public static final int VARROCK_X = 3210;
	public static final int VARROCK_Y = 3424;
	public static final String VARROCK = "";

would be one. Change the 3210 and 3424 with the X and Y cords of the place you want Varrock Teleport to take you to.

This would be if you have PI and you want to change a teleport location (without putting up the options of other multiple places, not sure how to do that.)

Read full topic
